author: Cameron Tate (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Atkins downs Mayflower, 35-34
text: slideshow ATKINS — The Atkins Red Devils waited until the last minutes of the game to make their comeback and earn a victory over the Mayflower Eagles on Friday at Sorrels Stadium at Lemley Field. The Red Devils, cheered on by their fans, managed to win 35-34.Atkins (4-4, 2-3 3A-2 Conference) received the ball to start the game, but turned it over after nine plays.. The Eagles (3-5, 3-2) immediately fumbled, and it was recovered by Coby Robinson of the Red Devils.Atkins wasted no time, scoring the first touchdown of the night with a 10-yard run by Devin Dollar on the very next play. Atkins missed the PAT however, making the score 6-0 with just over nine minutes in the first quarter.Atkins kept the momentum going, shutting down Mayflower’s offense and taking the ball back in four short plays. Atkins scored a second TD with a 4-yard pass to Nick Gray. The Red Devils followed up with a 2-point conversion to make it 14-0.Atkins kicked the ball to Mayflower’s 34-yard line, where it was caught by Marcus Harper Jr. and run all the way back for Mayflower’s first TD. The PAT was good, cutting Atkins' lead to 14-7.After several uneventful possessions by both teams, the Red Devils Jessie Jones was able to score a TD. The PAT was successful, making the score 21-7 for Atkins with just over three minutes left in the first half.Mayflower scored one more touchdown and PAT just before the half ended. The Eagles controlled the rest of the game, scoring three more touchdowns to go up at 34-21 with time running out.Motivated by the cheers from the Red Devil fans, Atkins Brandon Haney scored a TD, followed by the PAT, making the score 34-28 for the Eagles.With only five minutes left in the game, Atkins' Seth Haney made a 57-yard touchdown pass to Zack Harris. The Red Devils nailed the PAT to take the victory.Atkins will host Rose Bud next week.
